title: Condensed with drop shadow
content:
Designing an event that will be at the Wente Vineyard.

Does anyone know what font this is ?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331084507im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WenteLogo_5374.jpg)
author: kimbrown

comments.content:
I suspect this is a custom logo, perhaps based on modifications to a commercial font.  
Have you asked the company about the design of their logo?  
Don

Don't have the answer and even with a [better sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331084507/http:/ww1.prweb.com/prfiles/2008/03/05/747224/BWAttachment747224-3.jpg). Problem is I can't get out of my head [Times](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331084507/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/times). Funny thing is I'm pretty convinced it could be quite easy with it, mainly stretching it, pulling upward /E central crossbar and reworking a bit /T top stem serifs.  
My 2 cent now. If you need something in the same vein (minus the chiseled effect), [Beaufort](http://web.archive.org/web/20140331084507/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/shinn/beaufort) Condensed (Light) might work pretty well. Less contrasted but far more elegant.
Thanks for the comments. I will play around with Times.
